ingredient.1.name: 7-Up
ingredient.1.description: Lemon-lime carbonated soft drink. Sweet citrus profile with bright acidity and light bubbles. Typical ABV: 0%. Used to lengthen drinks and add sweetness and fizz in highballs like **Whiskey Highball** variations or **vodka 7-Up**.
ingredient.2.name: Absinthe
ingredient.2.description: Absinthe is an anise-forward spirit distilled with wormwood and other botanicals, typically 45–74% ABV. It is traditionally diluted with water to unlock its louche haze. Nicknamed the green fairy and linked to 19th-Century artists.
ingredient.3.name: Absolut Citron
ingredient.3.description: Citrus-flavored **vodka** from Absolut in Åhus, Sweden, about 40% ABV. a bright lemon character elevates **Cosmopolitans** and other citrus cocktails.
ingredient.4.name: Absolut Vodka
ingredient.4.description: Swedish winter wheat **vodka** from Åhus with about 40% ABV. Known for a clean, neutral profile and consistent quality. Popular base for countless cocktails worldwide.
ingredient.5.name: Acqua Bianca
ingredient.5.description: Acqua Bianca liqueur is a clear, vanilla-citrus egg liqueur style spirit with creamy sweetness and around 20% ABV.
ingredient.6.name: Agave Syrup
ingredient.6.description: Agave syrup is a honey-like sweetener made from blue agave and related plants. It has a mellow caramel sweetness and dissolves quickly in cold drinks. Common in **Margaritas** and other **tequila** cocktails.
ingredient.7.name: Aged Rum
ingredient.7.description: Rum aged in oak for deeper caramel and spice notes, typically around 40% ABV. Made from molasses or sugarcane juice. Smooth sipper that also suits **Old Fashioned**-style drinks.
ingredient.8.name: Ale
ingredient.8.description: Ale is a malty, fruity beer around 4–6% ABV. Enjoy it in a Shandy or Snakebite.
ingredient.9.name: Allspice
ingredient.9.description: Warm spice with clove, cinnamon, and nutmeg notes often used in **Tiki** syrups and punches.
ingredient.10.name: Allspice Dram
ingredient.10.description: Allspice-flavored liqueur around 22% ABV, is used in **Tiki** cocktails.
ingredient.11.name: Almond (Orgeat) Syrup
ingredient.11.description:
Almond syrup, aka *orgeat*, is a sweet, nutty syrup made from **almonds**, **sugar**, and **orange flower water**. It adds a creamy, aromatic quality to tropical and **Tiki** cocktails.
Instructions:
1. **Toast & grind:** preheat oven to 200°c. Toast **almonds** for 3–4 minutes until fragrant. Let cool, then pulse in a food processor until coarsely ground.
2. **Make syrup:** combine **sugar** and **water** in a saucepan over medium heat. Stir until dissolved, bring to a boil for 3 minutes, then add the ground almonds.
3. **Steep:** lower the heat and simmer for 3 minutes. Remove from heat, cover, and let infuse for 3 to 12 hours at room temperature.
4. **Strain:** pour through several layers of cheesecloth or a nut milk bag, squeezing hard to extract all almond oils and liquid.
5. **Finish:** stir in **orange flower water**. Transfer to a clean bottle.
ingredient.12.name: Amaretto
ingredient.12.description: Amaretto is an Italian almond liqueur at 21–28% ABV with a sweet, nutty flavour. Use it in **Godfather**.
ingredient.13.name: Amaro
ingredient.13.description: Amaro is a bitter-sweet Italian herbal liqueur produced by infusing alcohol with a blend of botanicals, including herbs, roots, spices, and citrus peels, then sweetening it and ageing the mixture.
ingredient.14.name: Amaro Averna
ingredient.14.description: Amaro Averna is an Italian herbal liqueur with an alcohol content of 29% ABV (58 proof). This Sicilian bitter-sweet digestif. Ideal for **Black Manhattan**.
ingredient.15.name: Amaro Montenegro
ingredient.15.description: Amaro Montenegro is a herbal Italian amaro from Bologna, 23% ABV. Mix it in a **Monte & Tonic** or **Paper Plane**.
ingredient.16.name: Amaro Nonino
ingredient.16.description: Amaro Nonino is a bittersweet amaro from Nonino Distillatori at 35% ABV. Ideal in a **Paper Plane** or **Black Manhattan**.
ingredient.17.name: Amontillado Sherry
ingredient.17.description: Nutty, amber sherry that begins as Fino before ageing oxidatively, around 16–18% ABV. Dry with savoury, toasted notes. Adds depth to cobblers and stirred cocktails.
ingredient.18.name: Angelica root
ingredient.18.description: Earthy, herbal root that adds dry bitterness to gins and aromatic bitters.
ingredient.19.name: Angostura Bitters
ingredient.19.description: Concentrated Trinidad bitters at 44.7% ABV made with gentian, herbs, and spices. Famous oversized label and closely guarded recipe. a few dashes add spice and bitterness to classics like the **Old Fashioned** or **Manhattan**.
ingredient.20.name: Anise
ingredient.20.description: Licorice-scented spice that brightens syrups, liqueurs, and garnishes.
ingredient.21.name: Aniseed Liqueur
ingredient.21.description: Aniseed is a sweet anise-flavored liqueur, typically 20–40% ABV. Try it in a **Greta Garbo** or **Northern Light**.
ingredient.22.name: Anisette
ingredient.22.description: Sweet anise-flavored liqueur around 25% ABV. Clear and aromatic with liquorice character. Served chilled, with coffee, or in pastis-style mixes.
ingredient.23.name: Aperol
ingredient.23.description: Aperol is a bright orange aperitif from the Campari group, 11% ABV, with bitter citrus and rhubarb notes. Perfect for an **Aperol Spritz** or **Paper Plane**.
ingredient.24.name: Apple
ingredient.24.description: Crisp, sweet-tart fruit used for juices, garnishes, and infusions. Adds fresh orchard aroma to cocktails.
ingredient.25.name: Apple Brandy
ingredient.25.description: Fruit brandy distilled from apples, typically 40–50% ABV. Offers baked-apple and spice notes from barrel ageing. Great in **Jack Rose**-style cocktails.
ingredient.26.name: Apple Cider
ingredient.26.description: Apple cider is a crisp fermented apple drink at 4–6% ABV. Enjoy it in a **Snakebite** or **Stone Fence**.
ingredient.27.name: Apple Juice
ingredient.27.description: Sweet pressed apple juice with crisp acidity. Adds gentle fruitiness to punches and highballs. Works with rum, bourbon, and cider-inspired cocktails.
ingredient.28.name: Apple Liqueur
ingredient.28.description: Apple liqueur is a sweet apple spirit around 15–30% ABV. Shake it into **Appletini** or **apple Jack** cocktails.
ingredient.29.name: Apple Schnapps
ingredient.29.description: Apple schnapps is a tart apple spirit with roughly 15–25% ABV. Use it in an **apple Pie shot** or **Appletini** cocktail.
ingredient.30.name: Applejack
ingredient.30.description: American apple spirit is often blended with neutral grain, usually 40–50% ABV. Brings baked-apple flavour with subtle oak. Classic choice for **Jack Rose** and **Old Fashioned** riffs.
ingredient.31.name: Apricot Brandy
ingredient.31.description: Apricot-based brandy or liqueur with stone-fruit sweetness, usually 30–40% ABV. Adds jammy orchard notes to cocktails. Useful in sours and Tiki drinks.
ingredient.32.name: Apricot Nectar
ingredient.32.description: Sweet, thick apricot juice blend that brings mellow stone-fruit flavour. Great for Tiki drinks, spritzes, and punches.
ingredient.33.name: Ardbeg
ingredient.33.description: Islay single malt scotch is famed for intense peat smoke and maritime notes, typically around 46% ABV. Distilled on Islay’s south coast. Bold choice for **Penicillin** variations or neat sipping.
ingredient.34.name: Bacardi 151 Proof Rum
ingredient.34.description: Very high-proof rum at 75½% ABV once made by bacardi. Powerful caramel and molasses notes suited to punches or flaming drinks. Handle carefully and dilute in cocktails.
ingredient.35.name: Baileys
ingredient.35.description: Baileys Irish cream is a creamy liqueur by Diageo, 17% ABV, with chocolate and whiskey notes. Serve in a **Mudslide** or **B-52**.
ingredient.36.name: Banana
ingredient.36.description: Soft, sweet fruit with creamy texture used for smoothies and Tiki garnishes. Works well in frozen cocktails or batched punches.
ingredient.37.name: Banana Liqueur
ingredient.37.description: Banana liqueur is a sweet banana spirit about 20–25% ABV. Mix it in a **Banana Daiquiri** or **Dirty Banana**.
ingredient.38.name: Banana Liqueur Green
ingredient.38.description: Vivid green banana liqueur with sweet tropical aroma around 20–25% ABV. Adds color and ripe banana notes to Tiki drinks and dessert cocktails.
ingredient.39.name: Basil
ingredient.39.description: Basil is a fragrant herb with a sweet, slightly peppery flavour. It adds a fresh and aromatic note to both alcoholic and non-alcoholic cocktails. Common in summer drinks, it pairs especially well with **gin**, **vodka**, and citrus juices.
ingredient.40.name: Becherovka
ingredient.40.description: Becherovka is a traditional, 100% natural czech herbal liqueur, made with a secret recipe of over 20 herbs and spices and an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 38%. It is often enjoyed as a digestif.
ingredient.41.name: Beef Bouillon
ingredient.41.description: Beef bouillon is a savoury broth made by simmering beef with vegetables and seasonings. In cocktails, it is primarily used in savoury drinks like the **Bloody Bull**, adding depth and umami richness.
ingredient.42.name: Beer
ingredient.42.description: Beer is a carbonated malt beverage around 4–6% ABV with malty, hoppy notes. Pour it into a **Michelada** or **Shandy**.
ingredient.43.name: Benedictine
ingredient.43.description: French herbal liqueur around 40% ABV with honeyed sweetness and spice. Created by Alexandre le Grand from a secret blend of botanicals. Essential in drinks like the **Vieux Carré** and **Singapore Sling**.
ingredient.44.name: Berentzen Apfelkorn
ingredient.44.description: Berentzen Apfelkorn is a German apple schnapps by Berentzen Group, 18% ABV. Enjoy it in an **apple Shot** or **apple Strudel** cocktail.
ingredient.45.name: Berries
ingredient.45.description: Mixed berries that deliver bright acidity and deep color. Perfect for dousing into **Spritzes** and **Sangria**.
ingredient.46.name: Bianco Vermouth
ingredient.46.description: Vermouth is an aromatised fortified wine around 15–18% ABV. Use it in a **Martini** or **Negroni**.
ingredient.47.name: Bison Grass Vodka
ingredient.47.description: Polish bison grass **vodka** (Żubrówka) around 37½–40% ABV flavored with aromatic sweet grass. Offers vanilla, almond, and herb notes. Great with apple juice or in refreshing highballs.
ingredient.48.name: Bittermens Boston Bittahs
ingredient.48.description: Citrus-forward bitters with grapefruit and hop notes. Brightens gin, rum, or **tequila** cocktails with gentle bitterness. Use a dash or two to add sparkle without heavy spice.
ingredient.49.name: Bitters
ingredient.49.description: Aromatic bitters are alcohol-based flavour concentrates infused with herbs and spices. Just a few dashes add bitterness, spice, and balance to cocktails. Keep them on the rail for **Old Fashioneds**, **Manhattans**, and sours.
ingredient.50.name: Black Pepper
ingredient.50.description: Cracked peppercorn heat for savoury cocktails or rimming a spicy **Bloody Mary**.
ingredient.51.name: Black Sambuca
ingredient.51.description: Dark anise liqueur with added liquorice and spice, around 38% ABV. Richer and slightly bitter compared to white sambuca. Served as shots, with coffee, or flaming in cocktails.
ingredient.52.name: Black Tea
ingredient.52.description: Black tea is a strong, full-bodied tea with a rich, tannic flavour. It can be used as a base for tea cocktails or as an infused mixer with spirits. Its bold taste pairs well with whiskey, rum, and fruit liqueurs.
ingredient.53.name: Blackberry
ingredient.53.description: Juicy dark berry with sweet-tart flavour. Ideal for muddling into brambles or simmering into berry syrups.
ingredient.54.name: Blackberry Brandy
ingredient.54.description: Brandy or liqueur flavored with blackberries, typically 30–40% ABV. Sweet, jammy berry notes with a warming finish. Works in sours, cobblers, and dessert drinks.
ingredient.55.name: Blackberry Liqueur
ingredient.55.description: Blackberry liqueur offers rich berry sweetness at about 18–20% ABV. Use it in a **Bramble** or **Blackberry Martini**.
ingredient.56.name: Blackcurrant Cordial
ingredient.56.description: Sweet blackcurrant syrup with deep berry color and tangy sweetness. Dilute with soda or water for a refreshing base. Great for spritzes, punches, or zero-proof cocktails.
ingredient.57.name: Blackstrap Rum
ingredient.57.description: Blackstrap rum is an intensely dark, full-bodied spirit characterised by a heavy molasses flavour profile. Unlike most rums that aim for smoothness or "funk," blackstrap is often thick, syrupy, and contains bittersweet notes of coffee, liquorice, and burnt sugar.
ingredient.58.name: Blood Orange
ingredient.58.description: Deep red-fleshed orange with berry-like citrus flavour. Anthocyanin pigments give it a vivid hue that develops in cool nights. Great for adding color to sours and spritzes.
ingredient.59.name: Blue Curaçao
ingredient.59.description: Blue curaçao is a blue-dyed orange liqueur, 20–25% ABV, with bitter citrus flavour. Star of the **Blue Lagoon** and **Blue Hawaii**.
ingredient.60.name: Blue Curaçao Syrup
ingredient.60.description: Blue curaçao syrup delivers sweet orange flavour with a vivid blue hue. It mimics the taste of curaçao liqueur without alcohol. Great for colourful tropical cocktails and lemonades.
ingredient.61.name: Blueberry
ingredient.61.description: Blueberries are an incredibly versatile cocktail ingredient, prized for their deep purple hue and balanced sweet-tart profile. They pair exceptionally well with **gin**, **vodka**, **tequila**, and **bourbon**.
ingredient.62.name: Blueberry Schnapps
ingredient.62.description: Blueberry schnapps is a fruity schnapps around 15–25% ABV. Try it in a **berry Kamikaze** or **Blueberry Martini**.
ingredient.63.name: Boiling Water
ingredient.63.description: Freshly boiled water used to dilute or build hot drinks. Essential for toddies, teas, and grogs. Use just off the boil to avoid scalding spirits or citrus.
ingredient.64.name: Borage
ingredient.64.description: Borage has a crisp, cucumber-like flavour that brings refreshing aroma to spritzes and highballs. the star-shaped blue flowers make striking garnishes for **gin** or **tequila** drinks. Muddle gently or float the blossoms to keep their delicate look.
ingredient.65.name: Bourbon
ingredient.65.description: American whiskey made primarily from corn and aged in new charred oak, usually 40–50% ABV. Offers caramel, vanilla, and baking spice notes. Staple for **Old Fashioneds**, **Manhattans**, and many classics.
ingredient.66.name: Brandy
ingredient.66.description: Distilled wine spirit aged in oak, commonly 36–60% ABV. Smooth notes of dried fruit, vanilla, and oak. Versatile for sipping neat or mixing in **sidecars** and **punches**.
ingredient.67.name: Brown Sugar
ingredient.67.description: Brown sugar is fine, moist cane sugar with molasses added back for color and flavour. It dissolves quickly and brings caramel notes to syrups and hot drinks. Light and dark varieties offer different molasses intensity.
ingredient.68.name: Butter
ingredient.68.description: Butter is churned dairy fat that adds richness and a silky mouthfeel. a small knob can soften boozy edges or balance spices in warm cocktails.
ingredient.69.name: Butterfinger candy bar
ingredient.69.description: Butterfinger is a candy bar manufactured by the ferrara candy company, a subsidiary of ferrero. the bar consists of a layered crispy peanut butter core covered in chocolate.
ingredient.70.name: Butterscotch Liqueur
ingredient.70.description: Butterscotch liqueur is a sweet caramel spirit about 15% ABV. Works in a butterball or caramel appletini.
ingredient.71.name: Butterscotch Schnapps
ingredient.71.description: Butterscotch schnapps is a toffee-flavored schnapps around 15–20% ABV. Ideal for a **Buttery Nipple** or **Oatmeal Cookie shot**.
ingredient.72.name: Cachaça
ingredient.72.description: Cachaça (Portuguese pronunciation: [kaˈʃasɐ]) is a distilled spirit made from fermented sugarcane juice. Also known as aguardente, pinga, caninha and other names, it is the most popular distilled alcoholic beverage in Brazil. Outside Brazil, cachaça is used almost exclusively as an ingredient in tropical drinks, with the **Caipirinha** being the most famous cocktail.
ingredient.73.name: Calvados
ingredient.73.description: Calvados is an apple brandy from the Normandy region of France, with an ABV typically between 40% and 45%. It has a complex flavour profile combining baked apple, spice, and oak notes. Calvados is often enjoyed neat or used in cocktails that highlight its rich fruit character.
ingredient.74.name: Campari
ingredient.74.description: Campari is a bitter orange aperitif by Campari group, roughly 20–28% ABV. Essential in a **Negroni** or **Americano**.
ingredient.75.name: Caramel Syrup
ingredient.75.description: Caramel syrup is a sweet, rich liquid made by caramelizing sugar and mixing it with water. It adds a toasty, buttery sweetness to cocktails, coffee drinks, and desserts. Perfect for enhancing creamy and dessert-style cocktails.
ingredient.76.name: Cardamom
ingredient.76.description: Fragrant cardamom pods bring citrusy, eucalyptus spice to syrups and infusions.
ingredient.77.name: Carpano Antica Formula Vermouth
ingredient.77.description: A rosso/sweet vermouth on steroids with plentiful dried fruit and vanilla tobacco.
ingredient.78.name: Celery
ingredient.78.description: Celery provides a fresh, crisp, and slightly peppery flavour to cocktails. It is commonly used as a garnish for Bloody Marys and other savoury drinks. Celery juice or muddled stalks can also add a refreshing vegetal note.
ingredient.79.name: Celery Salt
ingredient.79.description: Seasoned salt with celery seed that adds savoury lift to Bloody Marys and micheladas.
ingredient.80.name: Chambord
ingredient.80.description: Chambord is a black raspberry liqueur from France by brown‑forman, 16.5% ABV. Great in a French martini or Kir Royale.
ingredient.81.name: Chamomile Cordial
ingredient.81.description: Chamomile cordial is a sweet, floral syrup made from chamomile flowers. It has a soothing aroma and mild honey-like taste, making it a calming addition to cocktails. Pairs well with **gin**, **vodka**, and citrus juices.
ingredient.82.name: Chamomile flowers
ingredient.82.description: Chamomile flowers come from daisy-like plants and are primarily used for making calming herbal teas, in cooking, and in cosmetics due to their apple-like aroma.
ingredient.83.name: Champagne
ingredient.83.description: Champagne is a French sparkling wine around 12% ABV with crisp bubbles. Pour it in **Mimosa** or **French 75**.
ingredient.84.name: Cherry
ingredient.84.description: Sweet or tart red stone fruit often used as a garnish or muddled ingredient. Adds a pop of color and gentle sweetness.
ingredient.85.name: Cherry Brandy
ingredient.85.description: Cherry-based brandy or liqueur with deep red fruit character, around 30–40% ABV. Can be dry kirsch-style or sweetened. Adds cherry richness to classics like the **Singapore Sling**.
ingredient.86.name: Cherry Heering
ingredient.86.description: Cherry Heering is a Danish cherry liqueur by Heering, 24% ABV. Use it in a **Singapore Sling** or **Blood & Sand**.
ingredient.87.name: Cherry Juice
ingredient.87.description: Tart, ruby-coloured juice with rich cherry flavour. Ideal for sours, spritzes, or topping soda cocktails. Balances whiskey and rum drinks.
ingredient.88.name: Cherry Liqueur
ingredient.88.description: Cherry liqueur is a sweet-tart cherry spirit about 20% ABV. Mix it in a **Singapore Sling** or **cherry Smash**.
ingredient.89.name: Chestnut Liqueur
ingredient.89.description: Chestnut liqueur is nutty and sweet with 15–20% ABV. Try it in **Silver Bay** or **Apicius** cocktail.
ingredient.90.name: Chili Pepper
ingredient.90.description: Fresh chilli pepper adds bright heat to cocktails.
ingredient.91.name: Chili Powder
ingredient.91.description: Chili powder provides a warm, smoky heat that enhances savoury and adventurous cocktails. It is often used as a glass rim seasoning or mixed into syrups. Works well in **tequila** and **mezcal**-based drinks.
ingredient.92.name: Chocolate
ingredient.92.description: Rich cocoa-based ingredient used for desserts and cocktails. Shavings or chunks add aroma and slight bitterness. Perfect for garnishing creamy or coffee drinks.
ingredient.93.name: Chocolate Bitters
ingredient.93.description: Chocolate bitters are aromatic bitters with cocoa and spice flavours, typically around 40–45% ABV. They add depth to **whiskey**, **rum**, and **tequila** cocktails. a small dash can transform a dessert cocktail or **Old Fashioned**.
ingredient.94.name: Chocolate Liqueur
ingredient.94.description: Chocolate liqueur is a cocoa-flavored spirit roughly 15–20% ABV. Serve it in a **Chocolate Martini** or **Mudslide**.
ingredient.95.name: Chocolate Syrup
ingredient.95.description: Chocolate syrup is a rich cocoa sweetener used for dessert drinks. It adds chocolate aroma and body to milkshakes or creamy cocktails. Drizzle inside glasses for garnish.
ingredient.96.name: Cinnamon
ingredient.96.description: Sweet warming spice that blends into syrups and dustings for Tiki and winter drinks.
ingredient.97.name: Cinnamon Sticks
ingredient.97.description: Cinnamon sticks provide a warm, sweet spice when infused or used as a garnish. They release flavour gradually, making them ideal for hot cocktails. They also serve as decorative stirrers in seasonal drinks.
ingredient.98.name: Cinnamon Syrup
ingredient.98.description: Cinnamon syrup combines sugar with warming cinnamon spice. It brings cosy baking notes to Tiki drinks, punches, or coffee cocktails. Keep refrigerated for best flavour.
ingredient.99.name: Cloves
ingredient.99.description: Potent warming buds used sparingly in syrups, mulled mixes, and garnishes.
ingredient.100.name: Coca-Cola
ingredient.100.description: Coca-Cola is a caramelised cola soda created in the late 19th Century. Its blend of caffeine, sweetness, and spice makes it a versatile mixer with rum or whiskey. Bottlers worldwide sell it in cans, bottles, and fountain formats.
ingredient.101.name: Cocoa Powder
ingredient.101.description: Unsweetened cocoa powder delivers intense chocolate flavour. Dust over drinks or mix into syrups for a bittersweet note. Bloom in warm liquid to avoid clumping.
ingredient.102.name: Coconut Cream
ingredient.102.description: Coconut cream is a thick, rich product made from coconut flesh. It lends a smooth texture and tropical sweetness to cocktails like the **Piña Colada**. Perfect for creamy, dessert-like tropical drinks.
ingredient.103.name: Coconut Flakes
ingredient.103.description: Dried coconut shreds with sweet, tropical aroma. Toast them for deeper flavour before using as a garnish. Can be infused into syrups or milk for Tiki-style drinks.
ingredient.104.name: Coconut Liqueur
ingredient.104.description: Coconut liqueur is a tropical sweet spirit around 15–21% ABV. Blend it into a **Bahama Mama** or **Rafaello**.
ingredient.105.name: Coconut Milk
ingredient.105.description: Coconut milk is pressed from coconut flesh, giving a creamy texture with mild sweetness. It adds body and tropical flavour to blended drinks and punches.
ingredient.106.name: Coconut Rum
ingredient.106.description: Coconut rum infuses rum with coconut at about 21% ABV. Best in a **Piña Colada** or **Painkiller**.
ingredient.107.name: Coconut Syrup
ingredient.107.description:
Coconut syrup delivers sweet, creamy coconut flavour in a pourable form. Use it to mimic coconut cream without the heaviness. Perfect for Coladas, Spritzers, or coffee drinks.
Instructions: 
· 400 g of white sugar,
· 400 ml of unsweetened full-fat coconut milk,
· a pinch of salt.
In a medium saucepan, combine sugar, coconut milk, and salt. Stir over heat until sugar is completely dissolved.
ingredient.108.name: Coconut Water
ingredient.108.description: Light, naturally sweet water from young coconuts. Adds subtle coconut flavour and electrolytes to low-ABV or nonalcoholic drinks. Refreshing mixer with **rum**, **tequila**, or tropical fruit.
ingredient.109.name: Coffee Beans
ingredient.109.description: Coffee beans are used to infuse spirits or garnish coffee-flavored cocktails. They release aroma without adding sweetness. a single bean is often floated on drinks for decoration.
ingredient.110.name: Coffee Brandy
ingredient.110.description: Coffee brandy combines roasted coffee and brandy, roughly 20–30% ABV. Enjoy in a **Alexander the Great** or **Brandy Separator**.
ingredient.111.name: Coffee Liqueur
ingredient.111.description: Coffee liqueur is a sweet coffee spirit at 20–30% ABV. Perfect for a **White Lebowski** or **Espresso Martini**.
ingredient.112.name: Cognac
ingredient.112.description: French grape brandy from the Cognac region, double-distilled and aged in oak at 40% ABV. Shows dried fruit, vanilla, and floral notes. Premium choice for sipping or cocktails like the **Sidecar**.
ingredient.113.name: Cointreau
ingredient.113.description: Cointreau is an orange-flavored triple sec liqueur. It is consumed as an apéritif and digestif, and is a component of several well-known cocktails. It was originally called Curaçao Blanco triple sec.
ingredient.114.name: Cola
ingredient.114.description: Cola is a sweet, carbonated beverage with caramel, vanilla, and spice notes. It pairs well with rum, whiskey, and other dark spirits. Adds sweetness, color, and effervescence to cocktails.
ingredient.115.name: Condensed Milk
ingredient.115.description: Condensed milk is cow's milk reduced with sugar into a thick, shelf-stable syrup. It sweetens and enriches coffee cocktails, dessert drinks, and vietnamese-inspired mixes.
ingredient.116.name: Coriander
ingredient.116.description: Citrusy coriander seeds used to add bright spice to gin-inspired syrups and bitters.
ingredient.117.name: Corn Syrup
ingredient.117.description: Corn syrup is a neutral, viscous sweetener made from corn starch. It keeps sauces smooth and prevents crystallization in syrups. Bartenders sometimes use it for stable homemade sodas or garnishes.
ingredient.118.name: Corona
ingredient.118.description: Corona is a pale lager from Mexico, 4.5% ABV. Serve it in **Michelada** or **Corona Sunrise**.
ingredient.119.name: Cranberry Juice
ingredient.119.description: Cranberry juice is a tart, ruby drink often sweetened for cocktails. It adds acidity and color to drinks like the **Cosmopolitan** and **Cape Cod**.
ingredient.120.name: Cream
ingredient.120.description: Cream is the high-fat layer skimmed from milk. It lends body and mellow sweetness to shaken drinks, flips, and dessert cocktails.
ingredient.121.name: Creole Bitters
ingredient.121.description: Spice-driven bitters with baking spice, anise, and pepper notes. Great for **rum** and **rye** cocktails needing warmth and depth. Use sparingly to avoid overpowering citrus.
ingredient.122.name: Crown Royal
ingredient.122.description: Crown Royal, originally known as Seagram's Crown Royal, is a blended Canadian whisky.
ingredient.123.name: Crème de Banane
ingredient.123.description: Crème de Banane is a banana liqueur about 20% ABV. Use it in a **Banana Daiquiri** or **Bananarama**.
ingredient.124.name: Crème de Cacao Brown
ingredient.124.description: Dark Crème de Cacao is a chocolate liqueur around 20–25% ABV. Mix it in a **Brandy Alexander** or **Chocolate Martini**.
ingredient.125.name: Crème de Cacao White
ingredient.125.description: White Crème de Cacao is a clear cocoa liqueur around 20–25% ABV. Ideal in a **Grasshopper** or **Alexander**.
ingredient.126.name: Crème de Cafe
ingredient.126.description: Coffee-flavored liqueur with a smooth, sweet roast profile. Use it for **White Lebowski**, **espresso** cocktails, or dessert drinks.
ingredient.127.name: Crème de Cassis
ingredient.127.description: Crème de Cassis is a blackcurrant liqueur from France, 15–20% ABV. Key for a **Kir** or **El Diablo**.
ingredient.128.name: Crème de Menthe Green
ingredient.128.description: Green Crème de Menthe is a mint liqueur about 25% ABV. Use it in a **Grasshopper** or **Alexander's Sister**.
ingredient.129.name: Crème de Menthe White
ingredient.129.description: White Crème de Menthe is a clear mint liqueur about 25% ABV. Try it in a **Stinger** or **Green Tea** cocktail.
ingredient.130.name: Crème de Mure
ingredient.130.description: Crème de Mûre is a blackberry liqueur around 20% ABV. Ideal for a **Bramble** and **Mûre Royale**.
ingredient.131.name: Crème de Violette
ingredient.131.description: Crème de Violette is a floral violet liqueur at 16–20% ABV. Classic in an **Aviation** or **Blue Moon**.
ingredient.132.name: Cuban Aguardiente
ingredient.132.description: Cuban sugarcane spirit around 30–40% ABV with grassy, lightly sweet profile. Distilled from fermented molasses or juice. Used in traditional cuban cocktails and celebratory shots.
ingredient.133.name: Cucumber
ingredient.133.description: Cool, crisp fruit with refreshing vegetal notes. Excellent for muddling into gin cocktails and light spritzes.
ingredient.134.name: Cynar
ingredient.134.description: Cynar is an artichoke-based Italian amaro by the Campari group, 16.5% ABV. Mix it in a **Cynar Spritz** or **Bitter Giuseppe**.
ingredient.135.name: Daiquiri Bitters
ingredient.135.description: Bitters designed to complement rum and lime drinks. Adds bright spice and subtle tropical bitterness without masking acidity. a dash sharpens daiquiris or other light rum cocktails.
ingredient.136.name: Dark Rum
ingredient.136.description: Dark rum aged longer or with added molasses for deep caramel color, typically 40–50% ABV. flavours of brown sugar, spice, and vanilla. Great in Tiki drinks and punches.
ingredient.137.name: Demerara Rum
ingredient.137.description: Rum made from demerara sugar, often from guyana, around 40–50% ABV. Rich molasses, smoke, and toffee notes. Adds depth to Tiki cocktails and stirred rum drinks.
ingredient.138.name: Demerara Sugar
ingredient.138.description: Demerara sugar has large, crunchy crystals with natural molasses. It brings toffee-like sweetness and texture to syrups and muddled drinks. Less processed than standard brown sugar, so flavours stay mellow.
ingredient.139.name: Demerara Sugar Syrup
ingredient.139.description:
2 Parts demerara sugar to 1 part water.
Instructions: 
1. Add the 2 parts of sugar and 1 part water to a small saucepan.
2. Place over medium-low heat. Stir gently and continuously until the sugar crystals are completely dissolved.
ingredient.140.name: Disaronno Velvet
ingredient.140.description:
Disaronno Velvet is a smooth, all-white cream liqueur that blends the classic almond flavour of the original disaronno with creamy, velvety notes of chocolate and vanilla.
Disaronno Velvet has an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 17% and is designed to be enjoyed primarily over ice.
ingredient.141.name: Don's Mix
ingredient.141.description:
Don's Mix — the legendary secret ingredient in Tiki classics like the **Zombie** — is actually quite simple once you break it down into two parts: **cinnamon syrup** and **white grapefruit juice**.
Instructions:
**Make the cinnamon syrup**
The "secret" to the mix is a basic simple syrup infused with cinnamon. 
Ingredients: 240 g of sugar, 240 ml of water, and 3 cinnamon sticks.
1. Crush the cinnamon sticks (using a rolling pin or mallet) into smaller pieces to release more flavour.
2. Combine the sugar, water, and crushed cinnamon in a saucepan.
3. Bring the mixture to a boil, stirring until the sugar is fully dissolved.
4. Reduce the heat and simmer for about 2 minutes.
5. Remove from heat, cover the pan, and let it sit for at least 2 hours.
6. Pour the syrup through a fine-mesh strainer or cheesecloth into a jar. 
**Blend the Final Mix**
Combine 2 parts white grapefruit juice with 1 part cinnamon syrup.
ingredient.142.name: Drambuie
ingredient.142.description: Scottish liqueur blending Scotch whisky with heather honey, herbs, and spices at about 40% ABV. Smooth, sweet, and spiced. Signature ingredient in the **Rusty Nail**.
ingredient.143.name: Dried Apricot
ingredient.143.description: Chewy, concentrated apricot with honeyed sweetness. Great for infusions, garnishes, or simmering into syrup.
ingredient.144.name: Dry Vermouth
ingredient.144.description: Dry vermouth is an herbal fortified wine around 15–18% ABV. Essential for a **Martini** or **Gibson**.
ingredient.145.name: Dubonnet
ingredient.145.description: Dubonnet is a sweet aperitif by Pernod Ricard, about 14.8% ABV, with spiced wine notes. Serve in a **Dubonnet cocktail**.
ingredient.146.name: Earl Gray Tea
ingredient.146.description: Black tea scented with bergamot citrus. Steeped leaves make aromatic syrups or tea bases for spritzes and toddies. Slight bitterness pairs well with **gin** or **whisky**.
ingredient.147.name: Egg
ingredient.147.description: Whole egg adds richness and foam to flips and nogs. Shake hard to fully emulsify. Use fresh eggs and follow safe-handling guidelines.
ingredient.148.name: Egg Liqueur (Advocaat)
ingredient.148.description: Egg liqueur is a creamy egg-based spirit at 14–20% ABV. Sip it in a **Snowball** or **Dutch Coffee**.
ingredient.149.name: Egg White
ingredient.149.description: Egg white creates silky texture and a stable foam in sours and fizzes. Dry shake first to build structure, then add ice to chill. Always use fresh eggs or pasteurized cartons.
ingredient.150.name: Egg Yolk
ingredient.150.description: Egg yolk delivers custardy body to flips and eggnog-style drinks. Combine with sugar and spice for dessert-like cocktails. Use immediately and keep chilled for safety.
ingredient.151.name: Elderflower Cordial
ingredient.151.description: Elderflower cordial is a soft drink made largely from a refined sugar and water solution and uses the flowers of the european elderberry.
ingredient.152.name: Espresso Coffee
ingredient.152.description: Concentrated coffee shot with rich crema and intense bitterness. Adds depth to coffee cocktails like an **Espresso Martini**. Use freshly pulled espresso for the best foam and aroma.
ingredient.153.name: Everclear
ingredient.153.description: Neutral grain spirit sold at very high proofs up to 95% ABV. Odourless and colourless, used for infusions and punches. Must be heavily diluted before drinking.
ingredient.154.name: Falernum
ingredient.154.description: Falernum is a Caribbean syrup flavored with almond, ginger, lime, and baking spices. It can be alcoholic or not but is always thick and lightly spiced. Use it to bring tropical warmth to Tiki recipes.
ingredient.155.name: Fernet Branca
ingredient.155.description: Fernet is a type of Italian amaro with an ABV of 39–45%. It is intensely bitter and herbal, with notes of mint, myrrh, and saffron. Often taken as a shot or used sparingly in cocktails for depth.
ingredient.156.name: Fig
ingredient.156.description: Fig adds a rich, gently sweet flavour with notes of honey, dried fruit, and a hint of earthiness. In cocktails, it brings warmth and depth, pairing beautifully with **whiskey**, **rum**, **brandy**, and herbal liqueurs. Perfect for autumnal, dessert, or slow-sipping drinks.
ingredient.157.name: Fino Sherry
ingredient.157.description: Pale, bone-dry sherry aged under flor with delicate almond and saline notes. Sip chilled or mix into light, nutty cocktails.
ingredient.158.name: Frangelico
ingredient.158.description: Frangelico is an Italian hazelnut liqueur by Gruppo Campari, 20% ABV. Works in a **Nutty Martini** or a **Chocolate Cake Shot**.
ingredient.159.name: Fresca
ingredient.159.description: Fresca is a grapefruit-flavored diet soda with a crisp, dry finish. Zero sugar keeps cocktails lighter while adding bubbles. Mix with **tequila**, **gin**, or **vodka** for bright spritzes.
ingredient.160.name: Galliano
ingredient.160.description: Italian vanilla-anise herbal liqueur around 30% ABV. Tall golden bottle with flavours of vanilla, citrus, and spice. Key for **Harvey Wallbangers** and modern coffee drinks.
ingredient.161.name: Gin
ingredient.161.description: Juniper-forward distilled spirit flavored with botanicals, typically 40–47% ABV. Offers piney, citrus, and spice notes depending on style. Foundation for **Martinis**, **Gin and Tonics**, and many classics.
ingredient.162.name: Ginger
ingredient.162.description: Spicy, aromatic root used fresh or ground for syrups, mules, and punches.
ingredient.163.name: Ginger Ale
ingredient.163.description: Ginger ale is a carbonated soft drink flavored with ginger.
ingredient.164.name: Ginger Beer
ingredient.164.description: Ginger beer is a sweetened and carbonated, usually non-alcoholic beverage, a type of soft drink. Historically it was a type of beer brewed by the natural fermentation of prepared ginger spice, yeast and sugar.
ingredient.165.name: Ginger Candy
ingredient.165.description: Sweet, spicy candied ginger pieces. Chop for garnish or muddle to add heat and aroma. Syrup from the jar can sweeten highballs or teas.
ingredient.166.name: Ginger Syrup
ingredient.166.description:
Ginger syrup packs spicy, fresh ginger heat balanced with sweetness. It mixes easily into highballs, sours, and zero-proof drinks. Adds a zesty kick without muddying fresh ginger.
**Instructions:**
· 360g of white sugar,
· 240 ml of water,
· 240g of fresh ginger
1. Peel the ginger and slice it into small pieces. Set aside. 
2. In a medium saucepan, combine sugar and water. 
3. Stir over heat until sugar is completely dissolved. 
4. Add sliced ginger and simmer for 3-5 minutes. Remove from heat. 
5. Seal and steep in the refrigerator for up to 24 hours. 
6. Strain syrup with a fine mesh strainer once steeping is complete.
ingredient.167.name: Godiva Liqueur
ingredient.167.description: Godiva liqueur is a Belgian chocolate spirit with about 15% ABV. Enjoy it in a **Chocolate Martini** or **Mocha Mudslide**.
ingredient.168.name: Gold Jamaican Rum
ingredient.168.description: The primary difference for gold Jamaican rum lies in its ageing process, which gives it a richer, more complex flavour profile than white rum, while being less bold and aged than dark rum. Jamaican Rums in general are known for their distinct "funky" character due to a unique high-ester fermentation process.
ingredient.169.name: Gold Puerto Rican Rum
ingredient.169.description: Lightly aged gold rum from puerto rico, around 40% ABV. Soft vanilla and caramel notes with a smooth finish. Reliable mixing rum for tropical cocktails.
ingredient.170.name: Gold Rum
ingredient.170.description:
Gold rum and spiced rum are distinct types of rum, differing primarily in their production and flavour profiles.

Gold rum features a smooth, rich flavour with notes of caramel, vanilla, and spice, often with hints of oak.
Aged in oak barrels, with the ageing process contributing to both color and flavour.
ingredient.171.name: Goldschläger
ingredient.171.description: Swiss cinnamon schnapps around 43% ABV with floating gold flakes. Sweet, spicy, and eye-catching. Often enjoyed chilled or in party shots.
ingredient.172.name: Gomme Syrup
ingredient.172.description: Gomme syrup is a drink sweetener commonly used instead of simple syrup in many classic cocktail recipes. While some people may refer to simple syrup as gum syrup, true gum syrup contains an emulsifier known as gum arabic, a natural gum made from the sap of two types of acacia tree.
ingredient.173.name: Goslings Rum
ingredient.173.description: Bermudian rum is best known for black seal, about 40–48% ABV. Dark, rich molasses character with a hint of spice. Classic choice for a **Dark 'n Stormy** or **Tiki** drinks.
ingredient.174.name: Gran Classico
ingredient.174.description: Gran Classico is a Swiss bitter aperitivo by Tempus Fugit, 28% ABV. Try it in a **Negroni** or **Spritz**.
ingredient.175.name: Grand Marnier
ingredient.175.description: Grand Marnier is an orange-flavored liqueur. It is made from a blend of **cognac** brandy, distilled essence of bitter orange, and sugar. Grand Marnier Cordon Rouge is 40% alcohol (70 proof in the uk, 80 proof in the US).
ingredient.176.name: Grape Juice
ingredient.176.description: Sweet purple grape juice with jammy notes. Useful for spritzes, **Sangria** bases, or nonalcoholic mixes. Pairs with **vodka**, **gin**, or **sparkling wine**.
ingredient.177.name: Grapefruit
ingredient.177.description: Grapefruit adds a tangy, slightly bitter citrus flavour to cocktails. It can be juiced, sliced, or used as a garnish. Works well in **palomas**, **greyhounds**, and **gin** drinks.
ingredient.178.name: Grapefruit Juice
ingredient.178.description: Bitter-sweet citrus juice with bright aroma. Great for **palomas**, **greyhounds**, and other highballs. Adds refreshing bitterness to balance sweet liqueurs.
ingredient.179.name: Grapefruit Soda
ingredient.179.description: Pink grapefruit soda is a sweet and tart, sparkling citrus drink. It pairs beautifully with **tequila** in a **Paloma**. Adds both flavour and fizz.
ingredient.180.name: Grapes
ingredient.180.description: Juicy berries ranging from sweet to tart depending on the variety. Use for muddling, juicing, or fresh garnishes.
ingredient.181.name: Grappa
ingredient.181.description: Grappa is an Italian pomace brandy with an ABV of 35–60%. It has a strong, dry, and sometimes floral profile. Traditionally sipped neat after meals.
ingredient.182.name: Green Chartreuse
ingredient.182.description: Herbal liqueur made by Carthusian monks with 130 botanicals, bottled at 55% ABV. Vivid green color with intense herbal, honey, and spice notes. Key ingredient in the **Last Word** and many modern cocktails.
ingredient.183.name: Grenadine
ingredient.183.description: Grenadine is a deep-red, nonalcoholic syrup with tart-sweet pomegranate flavour. It colours cocktails pink or crimson while adding fruity brightness. Quality versions lean on real pomegranate instead of artificial cherry.
ingredient.184.name: Guinness
ingredient.184.description: Guinness is an Irish stout, 4.2% ABV, with creamy roasted notes. Pour it in a **Black Velvet** or **Irish Slammer**.
ingredient.185.name: Half-and-half
ingredient.185.description: Half and half is an equal-parts blend of milk and cream typically used in coffee. It carries about 12.5% butterfat with a light, silky texture. Use it when you want more richness than milk without the weight of heavy cream.
ingredient.186.name: Hazelnut Liqueur
ingredient.186.description: Hazelnut liqueur is sweet and nutty, around 20% ABV. Use it in a **Nutty Lebowski** or **Hazelnut Martini**.
ingredient.187.name: Heavy Cream
ingredient.187.description: Heavy cream is a high-butterfat dairy product separated from milk. Its richness softens strong spirits and adds velvety texture to flips or dessert cocktails. It can also be whipped for topping boozy drinks.
ingredient.188.name: Hennessy XO
ingredient.188.description: Hennessy is a world-famous **cognac** brand with an ABV of 40%. It offers rich notes of fruit, vanilla, and oak from barrel ageing. Enjoyed neat, on the rocks, or in classic cocktails.
ingredient.189.name: Hibiscus Syrup
ingredient.189.description: A ruby-red syrup with tart floral flavour that brings color and brightness to alcohol-free cocktails.
ingredient.190.name: Honey
ingredient.190.description: Natural sweetener with floral notes that vary by bloom. Thicken it into a 1:1 honey syrup for easier mixing. Balances citrus and whiskey cocktails beautifully.
ingredient.191.name: Honey Syrup
ingredient.191.description:
Usually, in cocktails, a honey syrup is used with 3 parts of honey and 1 part of water.
Instructions:
1. Add 3 parts of honey and 1 part of water to a small saucepan.
2. Set over low to medium-low heat.
3. Whisk or stir until the honey is fully dissolved in the water (usually 1–2 minutes).
3. Let it cool to room temperature. 4. Pour into an airtight glass jar or squeeze bottle and refrigerate.
ingredient.192.name: Honeydew Melon
ingredient.192.description: The honeydew melon is a sweet, juicy, and refreshing fruit, known for its pale green flesh and smooth, creamy-yellow rind when ripe.
ingredient.193.name: Hot Chocolate (Cacao)
ingredient.193.description: Hot chocolate (cacao) is a sweetened cocoa beverage blended with milk or cream. It brings chocolate flavour and warmth to winter cocktails. Spike it with liqueurs or spirits for cosy serves.
ingredient.194.name: Hot Sauce
ingredient.194.description: Vinegar-forward chilli sauce that brings heat to **Michelada**, **Bloody Mary**, and spicy rims.
ingredient.195.name: Hpnotiq
ingredient.195.description: Hpnotiq is a blue tropical liqueur, 17% ABV, with passion fruit and citrus. Mix it in an **Incredible Hulk** or **Hpnotiq Breeze**.
ingredient.196.name: Ice
ingredient.196.description: Frozen water that chills and dilutes cocktails. Use large cubes for slower melt or crushed ice for Tiki drinks. Clear, fresh ice keeps flavours clean.
ingredient.197.name: Ice Cream
ingredient.197.description: Ice cream adds richness, sweetness, and creaminess to cocktails. It blends with spirits to create indulgent dessert drinks. Popular in spiked milkshakes and floats.
ingredient.198.name: Irish Cream
ingredient.198.description: Irish cream is a creamy whiskey liqueur around 15–20% ABV. Great in an **Irish Slammer** or **Mudslide**.
ingredient.199.name: Irish Whiskey
ingredient.199.description: Irish whiskey is typically triple-distilled and aged at least three years, giving a smooth, light profile around 40% ABV. Shows malt sweetness with gentle fruit. Great for **Irish Coffee** or easy sipping.
ingredient.200.name: Islay Scotch Whisky
ingredient.200.description: Scotch whisky from the island of Islay known for peat smoke, sea spray, and iodine notes. Generally 40–46% ABV with a bold, coastal character. Sipped neat or used to add smoke to cocktails.
ingredient.201.name: Jack Daniels
ingredient.201.description: Tennessee whiskey brand. Smooth, slightly sweet profile with vanilla, caramel, and toasted oak notes. Typical ABV: 40%. Used as a base spirit in simple mixed drinks and whiskey-forward cocktails. Examples: **Jack & Coke**, **Lynchburg Lemonade**.
ingredient.202.name: Jamaican Dark Rum
ingredient.202.description: Pot-still heavy Jamaican rum with deep molasses and estery funk, usually around 40–50% ABV. Dark color from ageing and caramel. Adds bass notes to Tiki drinks and punches.
ingredient.203.name: Jamaican Rum
ingredient.203.description: Robust Jamaican rum is often pot-distilled, around 40–50% ABV. Expect ripe banana, molasses, and tropical spice aromas. Great in **Mai Tais** and rum punches.
ingredient.204.name: Japanese Whisky
ingredient.204.description: Whisky distilled in Japan using techniques inspired by Scotch, typically around 43% ABV. Balanced malt and grain blends with refined oak influence. Elegant choice for highballs and sipping.
ingredient.205.name: Jim Beam
ingredient.205.description: Kentucky straight bourbon around 40% ABV from the beam family distillery. Offers sweet corn, vanilla, and oak notes. Versatile for mixing or casual sipping.
ingredient.206.name: Johnnie Walker
ingredient.206.description: Global blended Scotch whisky brand commonly bottled at 40% ABV. Layered malt and grain flavours with gentle smoke depending on the label. Popular in highballs and spirit-forward cocktails.
ingredient.207.name: Jägermeister
ingredient.207.description: German herbal liqueur made from botanicals and spices. Sweet-bitter profile with herbal, citrus, and warming spice notes. Typical ABV: 35%. Used for herbal depth in shooters and modern mixed drinks. Examples: **Jägerbomb**, **Surfer on Acid**.
ingredient.208.name: Kahlua
ingredient.208.description: Kahlúa is a Mexican coffee liqueur by Pernod Ricard, 20% ABV. Perfect in a **White Lebowski** or **Espresso Martini**.
ingredient.209.name: Kina Lillet
ingredient.209.description: Kina Lillet was the original bitter, quinine-infused French aperitif (1887-1986) famously used in James Bond's **Vesper Martini** in Casino Royale, but it was reformulated without quinine in 1986, becoming the sweeter, less bitter Lillet Blanc we know today, with Cocchi Americano or kina l'avion often suggested as substitutes for the authentic bitter taste.
ingredient.210.name: Kirsch
ingredient.210.description: Kirsch, or kirschwasser, is a clear cherry brandy with 37–43% ABV. It is dry and aromatic, made from distilled cherries. Used in cocktails, desserts, and fondue recipes.
ingredient.211.name: Kiwi Fruit
ingredient.211.description: Bright green fruit with sweet-tart flavour and tiny seeds. Adds tropical freshness when muddled or pureed.
ingredient.212.name: Kiwi Fruit Liqueur
ingredient.212.description: Kiwi fruit liqueur is a tangy green liqueur around 15–20% ABV. Shake it into a **Kiwi Fruit Martini** or **Alligator**.
ingredient.213.name: Kombucha
ingredient.213.description: A lightly sparkling fermented tea with tangy acidity and gentle sweetness, useful as a non-alcoholic mixer.
ingredient.214.name: Kümmel liqueur
ingredient.214.description: Kummel is a sweet, aromatic liqueur flavored primarily with caraway seeds, cumin, and fennel, often with hints of anise and citrus. It is traditionally served ice-cold as a digestif after meals. Kummel liqueur typically has an alcohol by volume (ABV) ranging from 35% to 40%.
ingredient.215.name: Lagavulin 16 years
ingredient.215.description: Islay single malt aged 16 years around 43% ABV. Delivers peat smoke, dried fruit, and maritime richness. Best sipped neat or in bold whisky cocktails.
ingredient.216.name: Lager
ingredient.216.description: Lager is a crisp bottom-fermented beer around 4–5% ABV. Use it in a **Shandy** or **Michelada**.
ingredient.217.name: Laphroaig
ingredient.217.description: Iconic Islay single malt known for medicinal peat smoke and seaweed notes, about 40–48% ABV. Oak ageing adds vanilla sweetness beneath the smoke. Divisive but distinctive in cocktails or neat.
ingredient.218.name: Lavender Syrup
ingredient.218.description: Floral syrup made from lavender infusion and sugar, used in small amounts for aromatic depth.
ingredient.219.name: Lemon
ingredient.219.description: Bright, acidic citrus used for juice, zest, and garnish. High in citric acid, it sharpens sours and punches. Essential for classics from the **Lemon Drop** to the **Whiskey Sour**.
ingredient.220.name: Lemon Bitters
ingredient.220.description: Citrus bitters focused on bright lemon peel and spice. Ideal for lifting **gin**, **vodka**, or **whiskey** drinks with zesty bitterness. a couple dashes freshen **Spritzes** or **Collins** variations.
ingredient.221.name: Lemon Juice
ingredient.221.description: Fresh lemon juice with sharp acidity. Essential for sours and lemonades. Brightens spirits from **gin** to **whiskey**.
ingredient.222.name: Lemon Tonic
ingredient.222.description: Lemon tonic water combines quinine bitterness with bright lemon. Adds citrus zip and carbonation to **gin** or **vodka** drinks. Use when you want more zest than standard **tonic**.
ingredient.223.name: Lemon-Lime Soda
ingredient.223.description: Classic lemon-lime soda with gentle citrus sweetness and plenty of fizz. Balances tart spirits or liqueurs while keeping drinks light. Ideal for highballs and party punches.
ingredient.224.name: Lemonade
ingredient.224.description: Lemonade is a sweetened lemon beverage served either still or carbonated. Cloudy styles mix lemon juice, water, and sugar, while clear versions resemble fizzy lemon soda. Variations include pink lemonade or hard lemonade for boozy spins.
ingredient.225.name: Licor Beirão
ingredient.225.description: Portuguese herbal liqueur around 22% ABV made with a secret mix of spices. Sweet, aromatic, and lightly minty. Enjoyed chilled or in the **Caipirão** cocktail.
ingredient.226.name: Lillet Blanc
ingredient.226.description: Lillet Blanc is a French aperitif wine, 17% ABV, with citrus and floral notes. Key in a **Vesper** or a **Corpse Reviver no. 2**.
ingredient.227.name: Lime
ingredient.227.description: Zesty green citrus with sharp, aromatic juice. Common in mojitos, margaritas, and highballs. Provides acidity and freshness when muddled or juiced.
ingredient.228.name: Lime Juice
ingredient.228.description: Fresh lime juice that delivers tangy citrus oils. Classic in margaritas, daiquiris, and mojitos. Provides crisp acidity to balance sweetness.
ingredient.229.name: Limoncello
ingredient.229.description: Limoncello is a zesty Italian lemon liqueur at 25–30% ABV. Serve it in a **Gennaro's Sidecar** or **Amalfi Spritz**.
ingredient.230.name: Liquorice
ingredient.230.description: Sweet, earthy root flavour used in candies and herbal liqueurs. a small amount adds depth to syrups and bitters. Pair with anise or citrus to keep it lively.
ingredient.231.name: Luxardo Maraschino
ingredient.231.description: Maraschino liqueur is a clear cherry spirit around 24% ABV. Classic in an **Aviation** or **Last Word**.
ingredient.232.name: Lychee
ingredient.232.description: Fragrant tropical fruit with floral, lychee-perfume sweetness. Lovely in Spritzes, Lychee Martinis, and Tiki riffs.
ingredient.233.name: Malibu Rum
ingredient.233.description: Malibu is a coconut-flavored rum liqueur by Pernod Ricard, 21% ABV. Great in a **Piña Colada** and **Bahama Mama**.
ingredient.234.name: Mango
ingredient.234.description: Lush, sweet tropical fruit with silky texture. Blends smoothly into Daiquiris, Smoothies, and spicy Margaritas.
ingredient.235.name: Maple syrup
ingredient.235.description: Maple syrup is a natural sweetener made from reduced maple sap. Its caramelised, woody notes pair well with whiskey and coffee cocktails. Use sparingly since it is richer than simple syrup.
ingredient.236.name: Maraschino Cherry
ingredient.236.description:
Sweet preserved cherry commonly used as a garnish. Brings candy-like fruit notes to sours and **Old Fashioned** riffs.

Recipe:
**Ingredients:**
· 500 g fresh **cherries** (pitted), 
· 250 ml **Luxardo maraschino** liqueur,
· 150 g of **sugar**, 
· 100 ml of **water**, 
· 1 squeeze of **lemon**.
**Process:**
1. Simmer syrup: combine sugar, water, and lemon juice in a saucepan. Bring to a simmer until sugar dissolves.
2. Add liqueur: stir in the liqueur and simmer for 3 minutes to take the edge off the alcohol.
3. Heat cherries: add pitted cherries and simmer for another 2–3 minutes until slightly tender but still firm.
4. Cool & store: pour into a glass jar, ensuring cherries are submerged. Cool to room temperature before refrigerating.
ingredient.237.name: Melon Liqueur
ingredient.237.description: Melon liqueur is a sweet melon spirit about 20% ABV. Mix it in a **Japanese Slipper** or **Melon Ball**.
ingredient.238.name: Mezcal
ingredient.238.description: Smoky agave spirit from Mexico is produced by roasting agave hearts before distillation. Typically 40–55% ABV with earthy, roasted notes. Adds rustic smoke to **Margarita** riffs or neat pours.
ingredient.239.name: Midori Melon Liqueur
ingredient.239.description: Midori is a neon-green Japanese melon liqueur by suntory, 20% ABV. Use it in a **Midori Sour** or **Japanese Slipper**.
ingredient.240.name: Milk
ingredient.240.description: Milk is a nutrient-rich dairy liquid produced by mammals. Its mild sweetness and proteins add body, foam, and balance to shaken drinks or coffee cocktails. Choose whole milk for creaminess or lower-fat milk for a lighter sip.
ingredient.241.name: Mint
ingredient.241.description: Mint is a fragrant herb that provides a cool, refreshing flavour and aromatic lift to countless cocktails, most notably the **Mojito** and **Mint Julep**.
ingredient.242.name: Nutmeg
ingredient.242.description: Warm aromatic spice often grated over punches, eggnogs, and Tiki drinks.
ingredient.243.name: Old Tom Gin
ingredient.243.description: Old Tom gin is a sweeter style of gin with 40–45% ABV. It has a softer juniper profile and slight sweetness. Ideal for classic cocktails like the **Tom Collins**.
ingredient.244.name: Olive
ingredient.244.description: Briny, savoury fruit used to garnish Martinis and savoury cocktails. Adds a salty contrast to crisp spirits.
ingredient.245.name: Olive Brine
ingredient.245.description: Olive brine — or olive juice — is simply a mixture of salt, vinegar and water but as olives marinate, the liquid takes on a fantastically rich and delicious olive flavour. That salty goodness is a pungent boost that will deepen the flavour profile in your cooking.
ingredient.246.name: Oloroso Sherry
ingredient.246.description: Oloroso sherry is a fragrant, dry, oxidatively aged fortified wine from the Jerez region of Spain, known for its rich, nutty flavours at 15–20% ABV.
ingredient.247.name: Orange
ingredient.247.description: Oranges are versatile in cocktails, offering fresh juice, aromatic oils from peels (twists), or visual appeal through dehydrated slices. Popular in drinks like **Margaritas**, **Old Fashioneds**, and **Mimosas**, they add a sweet, bright, or bitter citrus note.
ingredient.248.name: Orange Bitters
ingredient.248.description: Orange bitters are aromatic bitters flavored with orange peel and spices. Use a dash or two to add bright citrus and gentle bitterness to stirred cocktails.
ingredient.249.name: Orange Curaçao
ingredient.249.description: Orange curaçao is an orange liqueur at 20–40% ABV with bittersweet citrus. Essential in a **Mai Tai** or **Sidecar**.
ingredient.250.name: Orange Flower Water
ingredient.250.description: Fragrant distillate from orange blossoms. Just a few drops perfume drinks like the ramos gin fizz. Overuse can dominate, so measure carefully.
ingredient.251.name: Orange Juice
ingredient.251.description: Sweet, sunny citrus juice with gentle acidity. Popular in brunch cocktails like the mimosa or screwdriver. Adds body and brightness to tropical mixes.
ingredient.252.name: Orange Liqueur
ingredient.252.description: Orange liqueur adds citrus sweetness at roughly 20–40% ABV. Try it in a **Margarita** or **Cosmopolitan**.
ingredient.253.name: Orange Marmalade
ingredient.253.description: Orange marmalade is a sweet citrus preserve that adds a bittersweet flavour.
ingredient.254.name: Oude Genever
ingredient.254.description: Traditional Dutch genever made with maltwine and botanicals, around 38–40% ABV. Malty, juniper-forward, and lightly sweet. Works in classic Martinez-style cocktails.
ingredient.255.name: Ouzo
ingredient.255.description: Ouzo (Greek: ούζο, ipa: [ˈuzo]) is an anise-flavored aperitif that is widely consumed in Greece and Cyprus. Its taste is similar to other anise liquors like pastis, sambuca, arak, rakı, and mastika, which are traditionally produced and consumed in Mediterranean countries.
ingredient.256.name: Overproof Rum
ingredient.256.description: Overproof rum has an ABV of 57% or higher, offering intense flavour and strength. It is used for floats, flaming drinks, and Tiki cocktails. Best handled with care.
ingredient.257.name: Palo Cortado Sherry
ingredient.257.description: Rare sherry style combining the aroma of Amontillado with the body of Oloroso. Offers dried fruit, citrus peel, and subtle nutty richness for stirred or fortified cocktails.
ingredient.258.name: Papaya
ingredient.258.description: Mild, sweet tropical fruit with buttery texture. Mash or blend it into Tiki drinks and tropical highballs.
ingredient.259.name: Papaya Juice
ingredient.259.description: Papaya juice is sweet, tropical, and slightly musky. It pairs well with **rum**, **tequila**, and tropical liqueurs. Adds smooth texture to exotic cocktails.
ingredient.260.name: Passion Fruit
ingredient.260.description: Passion fruit has a tangy, aromatic tropical flavour. the pulp can be scooped directly into cocktails. Popular in Tiki drinks and modern fruity creations.
ingredient.261.name: Passion Fruit Juice
ingredient.261.description: Tangy tropical juice with floral aroma. Brings sweet-tart punch to Tiki drinks and sours. Pairs especially well with **rum**, **tequila**, and **sparkling wine**.
ingredient.262.name: Passion Fruit Liqueur
ingredient.262.description: Passion fruit liqueur is a sweet tropical spirit with 15–20% ABV. It has exotic, tangy fruit notes. Works in fruity **Martinis** and **Tiki** blends.
ingredient.263.name: Passion Fruit Syrup
ingredient.263.description: Passion fruit syrup delivers tropical tartness with a perfumed aroma. It brightens Tiki cocktails like the hurricane or Jamaican classics. Also works in **Spritzes** or sodas when you want sharp fruit acidity.
ingredient.264.name: Passoa
ingredient.264.description: Passoã is a passion fruit liqueur from France, 14.9–17% ABV. Use it in a **Pornstar Martini** or **Hurricane**.
ingredient.265.name: Pastis
ingredient.265.description: French anise liqueur that turns cloudy with water, about 40–45% ABV. Flavored with liquorice and herbs. Commonly served diluted as an aperitif or used in cocktails.
ingredient.266.name: Peach
ingredient.266.description: Peaches bring soft, juicy sweetness to cocktails. They can be muddled, juiced, or pureed. Perfect in **Bellinis** and **Sangrias**.
ingredient.267.name: Peach Bitters
ingredient.267.description: A bitters is traditionally an alcoholic preparation flavored with botanical matter such that the end result is characterised by a bitter, sour, or bittersweet flavour. Numerous longstanding brands of bitters were originally developed as patent medicines, but are now sold as digestifs and cocktail flavourings.
ingredient.268.name: Peach Brandy
ingredient.268.description: Peach-based brandy or liqueur with ripe stone-fruit sweetness, typically 30–40% ABV. Sometimes aged for gentle oak warmth. Tasty in punches and cobblers.
ingredient.269.name: Peach Liqueur
ingredient.269.description: Peach liqueur is a sweet stone-fruit spirit around 20% ABV. Delicious in a **Bellini** or **Sex on the Beach**.
ingredient.270.name: Peach Schnapps
ingredient.270.description: Peach schnapps is a light peach spirit about 15–20% ABV. Ideal in a **Fuzzy Navel** or **Woo Woo**.
ingredient.271.name: Pedro Ximenez Sherry
ingredient.271.description: Pedro Ximénez is a sweet Spanish sherry around 15–18% ABV with raisin notes. Try it in a **PX Flip** or **Espresso Martini** twist.
ingredient.272.name: Peppermint Candy
ingredient.272.description: Sweet peppermint candies that add cool mint flavour. Crush or melt into syrups for dessert cocktails and hot drinks. Use as a garnish for festive presentations.
ingredient.273.name: Peppermint Schnapps
ingredient.273.description: Peppermint schnapps is a minty spirit at 15–30% ABV. Serve in an Alpine Avenger** or hot chocolate.
ingredient.274.name: Pepsi Cola
ingredient.274.description: Pepsi is a caramel-forward cola with vanilla and citrus notes. It adds sweetness, color, and bubbles to rum or whiskey mixes. Slightly softer than coke for smoother highballs.
ingredient.275.name: Pernod
ingredient.275.description: French anise spirit similar to pastis at about 40% ABV. Offers liquorice, herbs, and light sweetness. Used in absinthe-style serves and as a cocktail rinse.
ingredient.276.name: Peychaud's Bitters
ingredient.276.description: Peychaud’s bitters have 35–45% ABV and a floral, anise-like aroma. Essential in the Sazerac cocktail. Adds depth and complexity to many drinks.
ingredient.277.name: Physalis
ingredient.277.description: Tangy golden berry with papery husk and citrusy sweetness. Works well as a garnish or muddled into sours.
ingredient.278.name: Pilsner Lager
ingredient.278.description: Crisp, golden lager with gentle hops and a clean finish around 4–5% ABV. Light enough for **Shandies** or beer-based highballs.
ingredient.279.name: Pimm's No. 1
ingredient.279.description: Pimm's No. 1 is a gin-based fruit cup, 25% ABV. Classic in a **Pimm's Cup** or summer cup.
ingredient.280.name: Pineapple
ingredient.280.description: Pineapple is a versatile cocktail ingredient, offering a sweet-tart, tropical flavour that pairs perfectly with **rum**, **tequila**, and **gin** to create classic drinks like the **Piña Colada** and **Jungle Bird**.
ingredient.281.name: Pineapple Juice
ingredient.281.description: Sweet, tropical pineapple juice with natural froth. Key for **Piña Coladas**, **Painkillers**, and Tiki punches. Provides body, acidity, and aroma when shaken.
ingredient.282.name: Pineapple Syrup
ingredient.282.description: Pineapple syrup is a kind of simple syrup that takes advantage of pineapple's texturizing effect to produce a sweet-and-sour, musky syrup that is not only a classic Tiki ingredient, but also has uses in many early 20th Century cocktails.
ingredient.283.name: Pink Lemonade
ingredient.283.description: Pink lemonade is a lemon-based soft drink tinted with red fruit. It offers sweet-tart citrus with a hint of berry. Great for **Spritzes**, **Slushies**, or colourful punches.
ingredient.284.name: Pisang Ambon
ingredient.284.description: Pisang Ambon is a Dutch green banana liqueur, 21% ABV. Great in Indonesian-style cocktails or a **Green Tea** cocktail.
ingredient.285.name: Pisco
ingredient.285.description: Pisco is a colourless or yellowish-to-amber coloured brandy produced in the winemaking regions of Peru and Chile. Made by distilling fermented grape juice into a high-proof spirit.
ingredient.286.name: Plum Brandy
ingredient.286.description: Plum brandy is a popular fruit spirit made from fermented plum juice, widely celebrated in central and southeastern europe. It typically has an alcohol by volume (ABV) ranging from 40% to 50%, though traditional or homemade varieties can be much stronger.
ingredient.287.name: Pomegranate Juice
ingredient.287.description: Pomegranate juice is made from the fruit of the pomegranate. It is used in cooking both as a fresh juice and as a concentrated syrup.
ingredient.288.name: Prosecco
ingredient.288.description: Prosecco is an Italian sparkling wine around 11% ABV with light fruity notes. Perfect for **Bellini** or **Spritz**.
ingredient.289.name: Punt e Mes
ingredient.289.description: Punt e Mes is a bitter Italian vermouth, 16% ABV. Mix it in a **Negroni** or **Manhattan** variation.
ingredient.290.name: Raspberry
ingredient.290.description: Raspberries are sweet-tart berries with bright color and aroma. Used fresh, muddled, or as puree. Great in **champagne** cocktails and with **gin**.
ingredient.291.name: Raspberry Liqueur
ingredient.291.description: Raspberry liqueur is sweet-tart at about 20% ABV. Shake it into a **French Martini** or **Raspberry Collins**.
ingredient.292.name: Raspberry Syrup
ingredient.292.description: Raspberry syrup offers vivid berry sweetness with gentle tartness. It provides the signature flavour in clover club and other gin drinks. Swirl into sodas or desserts for color and aroma.
ingredient.293.name: Red Bull
ingredient.293.description: Red Bull is a caffeinated energy drink that adds sweetness and carbonation.
ingredient.294.name: Red Vermouth
ingredient.294.description: Red vermouth is a sweet spiced fortified wine around 15–18% ABV. Essential in a **Negroni** or **Manhattan**.
ingredient.295.name: Red Wine
ingredient.295.description: Red wine is a fermented grape wine at 12–15% ABV with tannic fruit notes. Use it in **Sangria** or a **New York Sour**.
ingredient.296.name: Rhum Martinique Agricole
ingredient.296.description: Rhum agricole from Martinique is distilled from fresh sugarcane juice, usually 40–55% ABV. Grassy, earthy, and slightly funky. Shines in **Rhum Mariano** and **Daiquiri** variations.
ingredient.297.name: Ricard
ingredient.297.description: Ricard is a French pastis at 45% ABV, with an intense anise flavour. Enjoy it in a **French Pearl** or **Mauresque**.
ingredient.298.name: Rich Simple Syrup
ingredient.298.description: Rich sugar syrup, or rich simple syrup, is sugar dissolved in water 2:1. It blends easily into cocktails and is a bar staple.
ingredient.299.name: Root Beer
ingredient.299.description: Root beer is a sweet North American soft drink traditionally flavored with sassafras or sarsaparilla. Modern versions are nonalcoholic, carbonated, and use artificial sassafras flavouring.
ingredient.300.name: Rose Syrup
ingredient.300.description: Rose syrup is floral and sweet, capturing fragrant rose petals. a few drops add aromatic lift to **gin**, **vodka**, or nonalcoholic spritzes. Use lightly to avoid overpowering other flavours.
ingredient.301.name: Rosemary
ingredient.301.description: Rosemary is a woody mediterranean herb with piney, resinous aroma. It adds savoury depth to **gin**, **whiskey**, and citrus cocktails whether infused or used as a garnish. Smack the sprig before serving to release its oils without overwhelming the drink.
ingredient.302.name: Rosemary Syrup
ingredient.302.description: A sugar syrup made with rosemary.
ingredient.303.name: Ruby Port
ingredient.303.description: Ruby port is a young red port wine at 19–20% ABV with fresh berry sweetness. Good in a **Ruby Manhattan** or **Porto Tonico**.
ingredient.304.name: Rumple Minze
ingredient.304.description: German peppermint schnapps bottled at 50% ABV. Intensely sweet and cooling. Served ice-cold or mixed into minty cocktails and shots.
ingredient.305.name: Rye Whiskey
ingredient.305.description: Whiskey with a rye-heavy mash bill, generally 40–50% ABV. Spicier and drier than bourbon with a peppery finish. Essential for **Manhattans**, **Sazeracs**, and other classics.
ingredient.306.name: Sage
ingredient.306.description: An aromatic herb with earthy, savoury notes that pairs well with citrus and berries in mocktails.
ingredient.307.name: Salt
ingredient.307.description: Common seasoning of sodium chloride is used to balance the sweetness or bitterness in drinks. Often rimming **Margarita** glasses or highlighting citrus-forward cocktails.
ingredient.308.name: Sambuca
ingredient.308.description: Sambuca is an Italian anise-flavored, usually colourless, liqueur. Its most common variety is often referred to as white sambuca to differentiate it from other varieties that are deep blue in color (black sambuca) or bright red (red sambuca). Like other anise-flavored liqueurs, the Ouzo effect is sometimes observed when combined with water.
ingredient.309.name: Sauvignon Blanc
ingredient.309.description: Sauvignon Blanc is a popular, dry white wine celebrated for its crispness, high acidity, and vibrant flavours. It is highly versatile and pairs well with a variety of foods.
ingredient.310.name: Scotch Highland Whisky
ingredient.310.description: Single malt Scotch from the highlands region, typically 40–46% ABV. flavours range from honeyed malt to gentle smoke. Versatile for sipping or cocktails.
ingredient.311.name: Scotch Whisky
ingredient.311.description: Whisky made in scotland and aged at least three years in oak at 40% ABV or higher. Styles span light and floral to heavily peated. Classic base for highballs and stirred drinks.
ingredient.312.name: Seagram's 7 Crown
ingredient.312.description: Seagram's Seven Crown, also called Seagram's seven, or simply Seven Crown, is an American blended whiskey produced by Diageo under the Seagram's name.
ingredient.313.name: Seedlip
ingredient.313.description: A non-alcoholic distilled spirit alternative with layered botanical notes, designed for zero-proof cocktails.
ingredient.314.name: Select
ingredient.314.description: Aperitivo Select is a classic, bittersweet Italian aperitif, known as the essential ingredient for the original **Venetian Spritz**, featuring complex notes from 30 botanicals. It has an alcohol by volume (ABV) of 17.5%.
ingredient.315.name: Silver Onion
ingredient.315.description: Pearl onions are sometimes used as savoury cocktail garnishes. The **Gibson** cocktail famously uses pickled onions. Adds a sharp, tangy bite.
ingredient.316.name: Simple Syrup
ingredient.316.description: Sugar syrup, or simple syrup, is sugar dissolved in water 1:1. It blends easily into cocktails and is a bar staple.
ingredient.317.name: Sloe Gin
ingredient.317.description: Sloe gin is a tart sloe berry liqueur at 15–30% ABV. Classic in a **Sloe Gin Fizz** or **Charlie Chaplin**.
ingredient.318.name: Soda Water
ingredient.318.description: Carbonated water that lightens and lengthens cocktails. Adds effervescence without extra sugar. Serve well-chilled for the best bubbles.
ingredient.319.name: Southern Comfort
ingredient.319.description: American liqueur of neutral spirit blended with fruit, spice, and whiskey flavour, about 35% ABV. Created in New Orleans in 1874. Easy-drinking base for punches and southern-style cocktails.
ingredient.320.name: Sparkling Wine
ingredient.320.description: Sparkling wine is an effervescent wine about 11–13% ABV. Enjoy it in a **Mimosa** or **Bellini**.
ingredient.321.name: Spiced Rum
ingredient.321.description: Rum infused with spices like vanilla, cinnamon, and clove, typically 35–40% ABV. Sweet and aromatic with amber color. Great in Tiki drinks, and warm punches.
ingredient.322.name: Sprite
ingredient.322.description: Sprite is a caffeine-free lemon-lime soda with bright citrus fizz. Provides sweetness and effervescence without heavy flavours. Reliable mixer for **vodka**, **gin**, or **whiskey** highballs.
ingredient.323.name: St-Germain
ingredient.323.description: St-Germain is a French elderflower liqueur, 20% ABV. Use it in a **St-Germain Spritz** or **Elderflower Collins**.
ingredient.324.name: Strawberry
ingredient.324.description: The garden strawberry is a widely grown hybrid species of the genus fragaria, collectively known as the strawberries. It is cultivated worldwide for its fruit. the fruit is widely appreciated for its characteristic aroma, bright red color, juicy texture, and sweetness.
ingredient.325.name: Strawberry Liqueur
ingredient.325.description: Strawberry liqueur is sweet and fruity around 20% ABV. Try it in a **Strawberry Daiquiri**.
ingredient.326.name: Strawberry Schnapps
ingredient.326.description: Strawberry schnapps is a sugary strawberry spirit about 15–20% ABV. Great in a **Strawberry Martini** or **Red Lebowski**.
ingredient.327.name: Strawberry Syrup
ingredient.327.description: Strawberry syrup is a sweet, fruity liquid that enhances cocktails with berry flavour. Ideal for summer drinks and lemonades.
ingredient.328.name: Strucchi Bitter
ingredient.328.description: Campari-style liqueur with a rich, persistent 27% ABV profile. Made from herbs, roots, and citrus peels that bring rhubarb, gentian, and cinchona notes. Finishes long with hints of aloe and germander.
ingredient.329.name: Sugar
ingredient.329.description: Sugar is the generic name for sweet-tasting, soluble carbohydrates, many of which are used in food.
ingredient.330.name: Suze
ingredient.330.description: Suze is a French gentian aperitif 20% ABV, with bitter herbal notes. Mix it in a **White Negroni** or **Suze & Tonic**.
ingredient.331.name: Tabasco
ingredient.331.description: Tabasco is a hot pepper sauce that adds spice and acidity to cocktails. It’s essential in **Bloody Marys**.
ingredient.332.name: Tawny Port
ingredient.332.description: Tawny port is barrel-aged Portuguese port around 19–20% ABV with nutty caramel flavours. Use it in a **Suburban** or **Bishop**.
ingredient.333.name: Tequila Añejo
ingredient.333.description: Tequila aged 1–3 years in oak, about 40% ABV. Smooth agave spirit with vanilla, caramel, and spice notes. Sip neat or use in spirit-forward cocktails.
ingredient.334.name: Tequila Blanco
ingredient.334.description: Tequila blanco is an unaged Mexican agave spirit with 38–40% ABV. It has fresh, grassy, and peppery notes.
ingredient.335.name: Tequila Gold
ingredient.335.description: Tequila gold is a blended or lightly aged **tequila** with 38–40% ABV. It has a smoother, slightly caramel flavour.
ingredient.336.name: Tequila Reposado
ingredient.336.description: Tequila reposado, meaning "rested," is a type of **tequila** aged in oak barrels for a minimum of two months to a maximum of one year, bridging the gap between unaged blanco and aged añejo. This ageing process imparts a golden hue and a smoother, more complex flavour with notes of wood, vanilla, or fruit, making it versatile for sipping neat, on the rocks, or in cocktails like Margaritas.
ingredient.337.name: Tia Maria
ingredient.337.description: Coffee liqueur from Jamaica made with rum, coffee beans, and vanilla, around 20% ABV. Smooth and sweet with rich espresso notes. Used in **Espresso Martinis** and dessert cocktails.
ingredient.338.name: Tomato Juice
ingredient.338.description: Tomato juice is a juice made from tomatoes, usually used as a beverage, either plain or in cocktails such as a **Bloody Mary** or **Michelada**.
ingredient.339.name: Tonic
ingredient.339.description: Tonic water (or Indian tonic water) is a carbonated soft drink in which quinine is dissolved. Originally used as a prophylactic against malaria, tonic water usually now has a significantly lower quinine content and is consumed for its distinctive bitter flavour. It is often used in mixed drinks, particularly in gin and tonic.
ingredient.340.name: Triple Sec
ingredient.340.description: Triple sec is a clear orange liqueur at 20–40% ABV with bright citrus. Essential in a **Margarita** or **Sidecar**.
ingredient.341.name: Vanilla
ingredient.341.description: Sweet floral bean used to infuse spirits or syrups with mellow bakery notes.
ingredient.342.name: Vanilla Bitters
ingredient.342.description: Vanilla bitters are concentrated botanical infusions used as "liquid spice" to add depth, warmth, and a creamy edge to cocktails. They are particularly effective in balancing the sweetness of dessert-style drinks and complementing the oaky or caramel notes in spirits like bourbon and aged rum.
ingredient.343.name: Vanilla Extract
ingredient.343.description: Concentrated vanilla flavouring; a few drops round out creamy or dessert-style cocktails.
ingredient.344.name: Vanilla Syrup
ingredient.344.description: Vanilla syrup infuses simple syrup with warm vanilla bean flavour. It softens sharp spirits and rounds out coffee or espresso cocktails. Drizzle in whipped cream drinks or soda floats.
ingredient.345.name: Vodka
ingredient.345.description: Neutral spirit distilled from grains or potatoes and filtered for a clean taste, usually around 40% ABV. Clear and versatile for mixing. Backbone of **Martinis**, **Bloody Marys**, and countless cocktails.
ingredient.346.name: Vodka Citron
ingredient.346.description: Lemon-flavored **vodka** is typically bottled around 40% ABV. Bright citrus aroma and a clean finish. Ideal for **Cosmopolitans**, **Spritzes**, and other refreshing drinks.
ingredient.347.name: Vodka Vanilla
ingredient.347.description: Vanilla-flavored **vodka** around 35–40% ABV. Adds smooth sweetness and vanilla bean aroma. Great in dessert cocktails or with cola and cream sodas.
ingredient.348.name: Walnut
ingredient.348.description: Walnut is a versatile cocktail ingredient that adds earthy, woody, and bittersweet notes to drinks.
ingredient.349.name: Water
ingredient.349.description: Water is a neutral, odourless liquid used for dilution and ice. Balance cocktails by adding water through shaking, stirring, or dilution. Fresh, clean water keeps flavours bright.
ingredient.350.name: Watermelon Juice
ingredient.350.description: Fresh watermelon juice with delicate sweetness and high refreshment for summer-style drinks.
ingredient.351.name: Whipped Cream
ingredient.351.description: Whipped cream is cream beaten until light and fluffy, often sweetened and flavored with vanilla. It doubles in volume as air is incorporated, creating a soft foam. Use it as a rich topping for coffee cocktails, hot drinks, and dessert serves.
ingredient.352.name: Whiskey
ingredient.352.description: Whisky or whiskey is a type of distilled alcoholic beverage made from fermented grain mash.
